--- Visit 1 | Date: 2025-06-25 ---

Follow-up visit #1 for patient SA-P007.

VS: 102/89 | HR 83 | Wt 77.4 kg. Patient mildly fatigued but alert and oriented.

No new adverse events reported since last visit.

Laboratory results:
  - PSA: 4.89 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0] (HIGH)
  - ALT: 9.37 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 32.99 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]
  - Hemoglobin: 13.16 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5]
  - WBC: 7.34 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0]
  - Creatinine: 0.95 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3]

Continue study protocol. Monitor labs. Return visit 2 scheduled in 3 weeks.

--- Visit 2 | Date: 2025-07-16 ---

Patient SA-P007 presents for scheduled cycle 2 visit.

Vital signs obtained: blood pressure 111/72, heart rate 80, weight 75.4 kg.

No new adverse events reported since last visit.

Labs drawn today:
  - PSA: 5.23 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0] (HIGH)
  - ALT: 13.72 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 31.98 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]
  - Hemoglobin: 13.05 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5]
  - WBC: 7.85 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0]
  - Creatinine: 1.03 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3]

Restaging CT demonstrates complete disappearance of all target lesions. No new lesions. RECIST assessment: Complete Response (CR).

PSA now 0.67 ng/mL — decrease 80.0% from initial value.

Plan: Continue current regimen. Follow up in 3 weeks.

Visit 3 clinical encounter for SA-P007.

Vital signs obtained: blood pressure 125/77, heart rate 76, weight 82.2 kg.

  - WBC: 6.91 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0]
  - Creatinine: 1.0 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3]

Assessment: Tolerating therapy. Plan to continue protocol. Next visit in 3 weeks.

--- Visit 4 | Date: 2025-08-27 ---

Scheduled visit 4 was not completed. unable to reach patient.

--- Visit 6 | Date: 2025-10-08 ---

SA-P007 — Cycle 6, Day 1 visit.

Vitals: BP 108/86 mmHg, HR 90 bpm, Weight 68.3 kg.

No new adverse events reported since last visit.

Blood work results:
  - PSA: 4.87 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0] (HIGH)
  - ALT: 17.25 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 34.08 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]

Imaging assessment: Target lesion decreased from baseline — measured reduction of approximately 36.3%. Partial response per RECIST 1.1 criteria.

PSA now 2.12 ng/mL — decrease 36.3% from initial value.

Continue study protocol. Monitor labs. Return visit 7 scheduled in 3 weeks.

--- Visit 7 | Date: 2025-10-29 ---

Visit 7 clinical encounter for SA-P007.

Vitals: BP 111/62 mmHg, HR 63 bpm, Weight 84.8 kg.

No new adverse events reported since last visit.

Routine labs obtained:
  - PSA: 4.42 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0] (HIGH)
  - ALT: 17.64 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 34.06 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]

--- Visit 8 | Date: 2025-11-19 ---

SA-P007 — Cycle 8, Day 1 visit.

Vitals: BP 154/72 mmHg, HR 79 bpm, Weight 81.1 kg.

Lab panel results from today's draw:
  - PSA: 3.42 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0]
  - ALT: 16.57 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 35.41 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]
  - Hemoglobin: 11.8 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5] (LOW)
  - WBC: 6.13 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0]
  - Creatinine: 1.19 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3]

Imaging assessment (CT chest/abdomen/pelvis): Complete response — no measurable disease identified. All previously noted target lesions have resolved. Classified as CR per RECIST 1.1.

Serum PSA: 1.28 ng/mL, representing a decrease of 61.5% compared to baseline.

Assessment: Tolerating therapy. Plan to continue protocol. Next visit in 3 weeks.
